verbs.description: sterilize (third-person singular simple present sterilizes, present participle sterilizing, simple past and past participle sterilized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deprive of the ability to procreate.
(transitive) To make unable to produce; to make unprofitable.

(transitive, biology) To kill, deactivate (denature), or destroy (break apart) all living, viable microorganisms and spores on a surface, in a fluid, or contained in a compound, such as culture media or a medical product.
(transitive) To redact (a document), removing classified or sensitive material.
examples: […]  (minus, of course, any information that might identify the agent and other operational personnel), or he might code it or "sterilize" it, and reward the foreign station chief in some other way.
